answers.answer: Hi,How are you feeling? What is your name?I think you are having what I feel is Restless Leg Syndrome.Restless legs syndrome (RLS) is a neurological disorder characterized by unpleasant sensations in the legs and an uncontrollable urge to move when at rest in an effort to relieve these feelings.Chronic diseases like kidney disease, diabetes, and peripheral neuropathy are also cause for RLS.If you are moving about in bed to relieve pain, have creepy and crawly feeling in leg, motor restlessness with increase in symptoms as night progresses, a diagnosis of RLS is certain.I think you should consult physician and another neurologist to re-evaluate your case.Bye.

Thank you for your comment.  Nightly the tingeling or numbness is in my hands or arms but about 3 nights out of 7 my feet or whole leg feels like this as well.  I dont feel an urge to move around but when I change postion the feeling goes away or moves. Last night, I was laying on my left side and my left arm/hand and leg/foot was asleep.  I moved and laid on my right and both my right and left arms and leg asleep.  It does not hurt or is painfull just bothersome.

Hi,The other causes of tingling and numbness can be nerve root pain due to nerve compression at the lower back, but you have done imaging, which is reported as essentially normal.The other causes can be due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, or Blood pressure irregularities causing such symptoms.You can get yourself evaluated by a physician and cardiologist to look for other causes of your symptoms.Bye.Happy holidays to you.

The imaging done was of my brain and my neck, nothing on my lower back.  I have had back surgery for scoliosis with 2 Harrington rods and some fussion done.  I have thought this was the cause but the Neurologist I am seeing does not think this is the case.I appreciate your thoughts.

Hi,When was the last imaging done for your lower back? Was it in recent past or quiet early?You have undergone surgery in your lower back, which also can be the cause for your bilateral numbness.I would appreciate if you ask your doctor for imaging of lower back.MRI would be the best modality.As I have mentioned about other causes you can visit a physician and evaluate further.Keep me informed about the disease progression and your health in general.Bye.

I have not had imaging done of my lower back for a long time (15 years???).  Like I mentioned my doctor said wait 2 months and reevaluate.  That would be in about 4 weeks, so far no change.  If anything it has gotten worse.Thanks again!

question: I am a 38 year healthy female.  For about 6 months I have been having numbness in my legs/feet and arms/hands but only at night.  I may wake up and have a hand asleep or a foot asleep or a whole leg numb.  I move around and it gets better but it is every night.  I never know what side of my body something will be asleep.  I have had an MRI of my brain, came back fine.  A MRI of my neck that showed some disk herniation but my doctor did not think this was the cause.  I had blood work done which indicated high B12 levels but my doctor did not think this was the cause either. A EMG which was fine.  My doctor does not know what is going on and said to wait 2  months to see what happens.  Any thoughts?
title: Night Numbness in Arms and Leg
